1.name: Little Women
1.description: Jo March and her sisters Meg, Beth, and Amy live in a happy family in Concord, Massachusetts. Jo yearns to be a writer, and through the course of the years, finds much within her own family...                See full summary »

2.name: Tarzan of the Apes
2.description: Reared by a childless ape, the orphaned heir of the Greystokes becomes one of the apes. Then, Dr Porter organises a rescue expedition, and his beautiful daughter, Jane, catches his attention. Has Tarzan of the Apes found the perfect mate?

3.name: Berg-Ejvind och hans hustru
3.description: A stranger comes to work at widow Halla's farm. Halla and the stranger fall in love, but when he is revealed as Eyvind, an escaped thief forced into crime by his family's starvation, they ...                See full summary »

4.name: Shoulder Arms
4.description: Charlie is a boot camp private who has a dream of being a hero who goes on a daring mission behind enemy lines.

5.name: Salome
5.description: When Herodias divorces her husband and marries his brother Herod Antipas, governor of Judea, the prophet John the Baptist protests and is imprisoned. Salome, daughter of Herodias and both ...                See full summary »

6.name: Himmelskibet
6.description: A group of researchers from Earth travel in a spaceship to Mars, where, to big surprise, they find a peaceful vegetarian and pacifist civilization.

7.name: Ich möchte kein Mann sein
7.description: A teenaged tomboy, tired of being bossed around by her strict guardian, impersonates a man so she can have more fun, but discovers that being the opposite sex isn't as easy as she had hoped.

8.name: Hearts of the World
8.description: Young lovers in a French village are torn apart with the coming of the Great War.

9.name: Stella Maris
9.description: Two young women - a paraplegic girl sheltered by her wealthy guardians and a more experienced orphan - fall in love with a man separated from his violent wife.

10.name: M'Liss
10.description: M'liss, a feisty young girl in a mining camp, falls for Charles Gray, the school teacher. Charles is implicated in a murder of which he is innocent, and the two must fight to save him from ...                See full summary »

11.name: Otets Sergiy
11.description: Prince Kasatsky is a just and proud youth, shock and disappointment with the world bring him to church, he becomes father Sergius. It is a story of his piety and temptation.

12.name: The Blue Bird
12.description: Two peasant children, Mytyl and Tyltyl, are led by Berylune, a fairy, to search for the Blue Bird of Happiness. Berylune gives Tyltyl a cap with a diamond setting, and when Tyltyl turns the...                See full summary »

13.name: Die Augen der Mumie Ma
13.description: A girl is kidnapped and held captive in an ancient Egyptian temple. She is rescued and flees to England, but soon finds that her mysterious captor is still haunting her.

15.name: Broadway Love
15.description: A small-town girl goes to New York hoping to become a star on Broadway, but the best she can do are roles as chorus girls. She falls in with a "fast" crowd, notably a "party girl" named ...                See full summary »

16.name: Carmen
16.description: The tragic story of Don Jose, a Spanish cavalryman, who falls under the spell of a gypsy girl, Carmen, who treats him with both love and contempt and leads him into temptation and thus ...                See full summary »

17.name: The Romance of Tarzan
17.description: Tarzan and Jane are to sail for England. They are attacked by natives and Tarzan is believed to have been killed. The Greystoke relatives return to England, the Porters (Jane's family) goes...                See full summary »

18.name: Mickey
18.description: Mickey, an orphan who has been brought up in a mining settlement, is sent to New York to live with her aunt.

19.name: The Master Mystery
19.description: Justice Department agent Quentin Locke must investigate a powerful cartel protected by a robot (here referred to as "The Automaton") and using a gas weapon "The Madagascar Madness".

20.name: The House of Hate
20.description: A young heiress of an American gun factory is threatened by a masked man after her father was murdered. This criminal might be a member of her family or a German agent, who wants to get ...                See full summary »

21.name: Das Eskimobaby
21.description: Young Polar Explorar brings Eskimo Ivigtut to his parents in Berlin. After experiencing Western culture, she finds herself pregnant but the explorer comes to her rescue.

23.name: Tih Minh
23.description: Jacques d'Athys, a French adventurer, returns to his home in Nice after an expedition to Indochina where he has picked up a Eurasian fiancée and a book that, unbeknownst to him, contains a ...                See full summary »

24.name: The Ghost of Rosy Taylor
24.description: Rhoda Eldridge lives in the Paris Latin Quarter, learns at the death of her father Charles that her real name is Sayles and that she has an uncle somewhere in America. She travels to the ...                See full summary »

25.name: The Phantom Riders
25.description: The head of a band of cattle rustlers is defied, prompting him to call his phantom riders together and route the defier's cattle, and then seek their owner intent on taking his life.

26.name: The Heart of Humanity
26.description: An American woman is terrorized by the ravages of war and a lecherous Prussian lieutenant when she becomes a Red Cross nurse overseas during the Great War.

27.name: The Dream Lady
27.description: After receiving an inheritance from an uncle, a woman sets up a fortunetelling business.

28.name: Chase Me Charlie
28.description: Chase Me Charlie was an anthology consisting of excerpts from several of Chaplin's short films made for the Essanay Company, including The Tramp, Shanghaied, In the Park and The Bank.

29.name: Little Orphant Annie
29.description: Surrounded by a group of children, poet James Whitcomb Riley narrates the story of Little Orphant Annie, who loses her mother at an early age and is sent to an orphanage. Annie charms the ...                See full summary »

30.name: Hands Up
30.description: A newspaperwoman finds trouble aplenty when an Inca tribe believes her to be the reincarnation of their long-lost princess.

31.name: Hell Bent
31.description: A cowboy must save his girlfriend from captivity and then cross the desert on foot with a single waterhole on the way.

32.name: Under the Greenwood Tree
32.description: Acting on her love of nature and loathing of titled fortune hunters, heiress Mary Hamilton leaves home with her secretary, Peggy Ingledew, to join a band of roving gypsies. One of Mary's ...                See full summary »

33.name: The Great Love
33.description: An idealistic young American during World War I, itching to fight the Germans and not wanting to wait until the U. S. joined the war, journeys to Canada and enlists in the British army. He ...                See full summary »

34.name: Storstadsfaror
34.description: About two orphanages children's upbringing in the countryside. Brynolf travels to his father in America. Inga moves to Stockholm for work. In the city lurks many dangers.

35.name: Lost on Dress Parade
35.description: Towers Chandler saves a little out of his weekly pay from an architect's office and uses it to have a night on the town every few weeks. On one outing he meets a shop girl. When he boasts ...                See full summary »

37.description: John Trimble has embezzled and obtains another identity by having a mutilated body buried in his place. He is later arrested for murdering himself. During the trial his mother, before dying...                See full summary »

38.name: Wild Women
38.description: Cheyenne Harry and his pals, bent on helping their friend Rawhide Jack, attend a rodeo with the intent to win the prize and to hand the winnings over to Jack. Harry is the successful winner...                See full summary »

40.name: The Mating of Marcella
40.description: Marcella Duranzo finds it increasingly difficult to support herself and her ailing father on her earnings as a clothing store fashion model, she accepts an assignment from Lois Underwood, ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Forbidden City
41.description: A Chinese mandarin hopes to regain favor with the Emporer by betrothing her to him, but he doesn't know she's secretly married to the American consul and pregnant.

43.description: During lunch, Cuthbert King asks his sister Phyllis for a loan to pay off his gambling debts. Upon leaving the restaurant, he accidentally takes the overcoat of antique jewelry dealer ...                See full summary »

44.name: Queen of the Sea
44.description: Merilla (Annette Kellerman), Queen of the Seas, finds a book among the wreckage at the bottom of the sea, that contains a prophecy that she shall save four human beings and then receive a ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Greatest Thing in Life
46.description: Jeannette Peret, daughter of a cigar-store owner, leaves her Greenwich Village home for France in hopes of finding there the love which eludes her at home. She becomes enamored of le Bebe, ...                See full summary »

48.name: Three Mounted Men
48.description: Fellow convicts Cheyenne Harry and Buck Masters become even more bitter enemies when Buck agrees to tamper with the prison's books for the warden's greedy son.

50.name: Society for Sale
